alert.note: Alert for Jackson (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 07 at 4:33PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM CDT/745 PM EDT/ THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Alabama, Panhandle Florida and southwest Georgia, including the following counties, in southeast Alabama, Houston. In Panhandle Florida, Jackson. In southwest Georgia, Early, Miller and Seminole. * WHEN...Until 645 PM CDT /745 PM EDT/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 333 PM CDT /433 PM EDT/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen in the last 1 Hour. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Marianna, Donalsonville, Malone, Grand Ridge, Greenwood, Jakin, Bascom, Lovedale, Buena Vista, Two Egg, Hornsville, Chattahoochee SP, Dellwood, Lucy, Crosby, Steam Mill, Chipola Terrace, Marianna Municipal A/P, Riverturn and Blue Spring. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
